byline.contributor: Reporting on the aftermath of the explosion and fire in the East Village was contributed by Matt A.V. Chaban, Annie Correal, Matt Flegenheimer, Jiha Ham, Benjamin Mueller, Tatiana Schlossberg, Nate Schweber, Liam Stack, Nikita Stewart, John Surico and Alex Vadukul. Susan Beachy contributed research.
byline.original: By MARC SANTORA and AL BAKER

abstract: Emergency workers in Manhattan begin arduous job of digging through debris from three East Village buildings leveled by gas explosion and fire; two people presumed missing from blast are identified as Nicholas Figueroa and Moises Ismael Locon Yac, adding extra burden of searching for remains as workers sift through wreckage.
lead_paragraph: Emergency workers began the delicate and complicated task of sifting through the debris of three buildings in the East Village that were destroyed the day before in an explosion and fire.

headline.main: At Least 2 People Missing After Explosion in Lower Manhattan
headline.print_headline: Workers Search for Victims Amid Pockets of Fire

snippet: Emergency workers began the delicate and complicated task of sifting through the debris of three buildings in the East Village that were destroyed the day before in an explosion and fire.
